Description: Part of a sheet of papyrus with hieratic text in black ink; part of a Late Ramesside Letter.
Excavator/field collector: Field Collection by: William John Bankes
Curator's comments: Published: R.J. Demarée The Bankes Late Ramesside Papyri (British Museum Research Publication 155; London: British Museum Press 2005),10-11, 40-41.

William John Bankes travelled in Egypt in 1815-1818, and is known to have collected papyri at Thebes on his second journey to Upper Egypt (1818). This papyrus is mounted on early 19th century grease-paper with a notation by Bankes himself marking it as document 'D'. The papyrus is from a batch of Late Ramesside Letters acquired in 1818 by Bankes.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (139353) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/139353)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Black ink Backed: goldbeaters skin Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: good
